gameComponents

Class Ray

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameComponents.GameComponent
      • gameComponents.Ray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Ray
extends GameComponent
    Virtual Optics

    This class models a ray of light

    Author:
    Darrin Fong, Tieme Togola
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double angle
      The orientation of the first segment of the ray
      private double h
      The x coordinate of the center of the circular shape of this light source, called h by convention

      Contains the indices of the components, in the list passed to the impact method, that were hit by this Ray object; i.e.
      private double k
      The y coordinate of the center of the circular shape of this light source, called k by convention
      private boolean on
      Tells if the light ray is on or off
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double> path
      Contains the points that trace the trajectory of this ray
      private double radius
      The radius of the light source, represented by a circular shape

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • path

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double> path
        Contains the points that trace the trajectory of this ray

      • hitComponent

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> hitComponent
        Contains the indices of the components, in the list passed to the impact method, that were hit by this Ray object; i.e. hitComponent.get(i) contains the index of the component hit by the ith point in the path

      • on

        private boolean on
        Tells if the light ray is on or off

      • angle

        private double angle
        The orientation of the first segment of the ray

      • radius

        private double radius
        The radius of the light source, represented by a circular shape

      • h

        private double h
        The x coordinate of the center of the circular shape of this light source, called h by convention

      • k

        private double k
        The y coordinate of the center of the circular shape of this light source, called k by convention

      • impact

        public void impact(java.util.ArrayList<GameComponent> components)
        Goes through the path and checks whether each segment intersects a component in the list of active components on the plane. If so, apply the appropriate optical formula to change the direction of the ray.
        Parameters:
        components - List of active components

      • findIndex

        private int findIndex(java.util.ArrayList<GameComponent> components)
        Finds the index of this Ray object in the list of active components
        Parameters:
        components - List of active game components
        Returns:
        The index of this ray

      • sameQuadrant

        public boolean sameQuadrant(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double origin,
                   java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double end,
                   java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double intersec)
        Description copied from class: GameComponent
        Checks that the intersection point is in the same quadrant of the 2D plane as the origin point and end point of a ray segment
        Overrides:
        sameQuadrant in class GameComponent
        Parameters:
        origin - The origin point of the ray segment
        end - The end point of the ray segment
        intersec - The intersection of the ray segment with this component
        Returns:
        True if the intersection is in the same quadrant, false otherwise
        See Also:
